body_html:
You should fix the build_all.sh script and add set -e to the top so that it exits on the first failing command and propagates the exit code. (I'd actually do set -ex because I like seeing what commands run.)

As for nvToolsExt.h, the way to debug this problem is to download the base docker image quoted at the beginning of the log:

11:08:44 + docker_args+=' registry.pytorch.org/pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3:123'
11:08:44 + retry docker pull registry.pytorch.org/pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3:123
11:08:44 + docker pull registry.pytorch.org/pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3:123
11:08:45 123: Pulling from pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3

and check yourself. You can run a docker image with docker run --rm -it $image_name

body:
You should fix the `build_all.sh` script and add `set -e` to the top so that it exits on the first failing command and propagates the exit code. (I'd actually do `set -ex` because I like seeing what commands run.)

As for `nvToolsExt.h`, the way to debug this problem is to download the base docker image quoted at the beginning of the log:

```
11:08:44 + docker_args+=' registry.pytorch.org/pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3:123'
11:08:44 + retry docker pull registry.pytorch.org/pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3:123
11:08:44 + docker pull registry.pytorch.org/pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3:123
11:08:45 123: Pulling from pytorch/pytorch-linux-xenial-cuda9-cudnn7-py3
```

and check yourself.  You can run a docker image with `docker run --rm -it $image_name`
